summary.long: Joshua is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Now after the death of Moses the servant of the Lord, the Lord spoke to Joshua son of Nun, the assistant of Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moses My servant is dead, so now get up and cross over the Jordan—you and all this people—to the land that I am giving to the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given you every place that the sole of your foot shall tread, as I said to Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the wilderness and this Lebanon, as far as the great river, the River Euphrates, all the land of the Hittites, and to the Mediterranean Sea toward the setting of the sun will be your territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man will be able to stand against you all the days of your life. As I was with Moses, I will be with you. I will not abandon you. I will not leave you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be strong and courageous, for you shall provide the land that I swore to their fathers to give them as an inheritance for this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be strong and very courageous, in order to act carefully in accordance with all the law that My servant Moses commanded you. Do not turn aside from it to the right or the left, so that you may succeed wherever you go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Book of the Law must not depart from your mouth. Meditate on it day and night so that you may act carefully according to all that is written in it. For then you will make your way successful, and you will be wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have not I commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or dismayed, for the Lord your God is with you wherever you go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua commanded the officers of the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Pass through the midst of the camp and command the people, ‘Prepare food, for in three days you will cross the Jordan to go to take possession of the land that the Lord your God is giving you to possess.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the Reubenites, the Gadites, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joshua said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember the word that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you: ‘The Lord your God has given you a place for rest and will give this land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your wives, your children, and your livestock may live in the land that Moses gave you on the east side of the Jordan. But you must cross over with your brothers fully armed, your mighty men of valor, and help them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until the Lord has given your brothers rest, as He has given you, and they also have possessed the land that the Lord your God is giving to them. Then you may return to your own land and possess what Moses the servant of the Lord gave you on the east side of the Jordan where the sun rises.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered Joshua, “All that you command us we will do, and wherever you send us we will go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as we obeyed Moses in all things, we will obey you. May the Lord your God be with you, as He was with Moses!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever rebels against your command and disobeys your words, in all that you command him, shall be put to death. Only be strong and courageous.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua son of Nun sent two men out from Shittim to spy, saying, “Go see the land, especially Jericho.” So they went, and they came to the house of a prostitute named Rahab. They spent the night there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Jericho was told, “Israelite men came here tonight to spy out the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king of Jericho sent orders to Rahab, “Bring out the men who came to you, who have entered your house, for they came to spy out the whole land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the woman had taken the two men and had hidden them. She said, “Yes, the men came to me, but I did not know where they were from.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men went out when it was time to shut the gate at dark. I do not know where the men went. Chase after them quickly, for you can overtake them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet she had brought them up to the roof. She hid them in the stalks of flax that she had spread out on the roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the men chased after them on the road to the Jordan as far as the fords. They shut the gate as soon as the pursuers went out after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before the spies went to sleep, Rahab went up to them on the roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to the men, “I know that the Lord has given you the land, for dread from you has fallen upon us, and all the inhabitants of the land melt in terror before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we heard how the Lord dried up the waters of the Red Sea before you when you came out of Egypt, and what you did to Sihon and Og, the two kings of the Amorites who were on the other side of the Jordan, whom you completely destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our hearts melted when we heard these things, and no man had any breath in him because of you, for the Lord your God is God in heaven above and on earth below.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So now, since I have acted faithfully toward you, please swear to me by the Lord that you will also act faithfully toward my father’s house. Please give me a firm pledge
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you will spare my father, my mother, my brothers, my sisters, and all whom they own, and that you will deliver our lives from death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men said to her, “Our lives for yours; if you do not report us, then when the Lord gives us the land, we will act faithfully and kindly with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rahab lowered them by a rope through the window, for her home was set into the wall where she lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to them, “Go to the hill country so that the pursuers do not find you. Hide there three days until the pursuers return. After that, you can go on your way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men said to her, “We will be free from this oath that you have made us swear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unless, when we come into the land, you tie this red cord to the window through which you let us down. You must bring your father, your mother, your brothers, and all who belong to your father’s household into your home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who comes out of the doors of your house into the street is responsible for his own blood, and we will be innocent. Yet for anyone who stays with you inside the house, we are responsible for his blood if someone should lay a hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you tell about this business of ours, then we will be released from the oath that you have made us swear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She said, “Let it be so, according to your words.”
Then she sent them off, and they departed. Then she tied the red cord in the window.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went and came to the hill country. They stayed there three days, until the pursuers returned. The pursuers had sought them all along the way but had not found them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the two men returned. They descended from the hill country. They crossed the river, came to Joshua son of Nun, and told him all that they had discovered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Joshua, “The Lord has surely given the whole land into our hands! Indeed, all the inhabitants of the land melt in terror before us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning Joshua got up early; then he and all the children of Israel set out from Shittim and came to the Jordan. They stayed there before crossing over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After three days the officers went through the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They commanded the people, “When you see the ark of the covenant of the Lord your God and the Levite priests carrying it, then you shall set out from where you are and go behind it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There must be a distance of two thousand cubits between you and it. Do not draw closer to it, in order that you may know the way you should go. For you have not passed this way before.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to the people, “Consecrate yourselves, for tomorrow the Lord will perform wondrous deeds among you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to the priests, “Pick up the ark of the covenant, and proceed ahead of the people.” So they picked up the ark of the covenant and went in front of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Joshua, “Today I will begin to honor you in the sight of all Israel, so that they may know that just as I was with Moses, so I will be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall command the priests who carry the ark of the covenant, ‘When you come to the bank of the Jordan, stand still in the river.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua said to the children of Israel, “Draw near and hear the words of the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua said, “By this you will know that the living God is among you, and that He will thoroughly drive out the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Hivites, the Perizzites, the Girgashites, the Amorites, and the Jebusites from before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, the ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the earth is passing before you into the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now select twelve men from the tribes of Israel, one man per tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the soles of the feet of the priests who bear the ark of the Lord, the Lord of all the earth, touch the water of the Jordan, the water of the Jordan that flows from upstream will be cut off and pile up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people set out from their tents to cross over the Jordan, the priests were carrying the ark of the covenant before the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the carriers of the ark came to the Jordan, the feet of the priests carrying the ark dipped into the edge of the water. (Now the Jordan overflows its banks all the days of the harvest.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the water that flows down from upstream stood still and rose up in a heap very far away at Adam, the city beside Zarethan. The water that flows down toward the Sea of Arabah (the Dead Sea) stopped and was cut off. The people crossed over opposite Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests carrying the ark of the covenant of the Lord stood firmly on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan, and all Israel crossed over on dry ground until the entire people completed crossing over the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the entire people had completed crossing over the Jordan, the Lord said to Joshua,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take twelve men from among the people, one man per tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command them: ‘Pick up twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan, from the place where the feet of the priests are standing; bring them over with you, and set them in the place you will camp tonight.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua summoned the twelve men he had appointed from among the children of Israel, one man per tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua said to them, “Cross over before the ark of the Lord your God into the middle of the Jordan. Each of you lift up a stone upon your shoulder, one for each of the tribes of the children of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that this will be a sign among you. When your children ask, ‘What do these stones mean to you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you will answer them that the waters of the Jordan were cut off before the ark of the covenant of the Lord. When it crossed the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off. These stones will be a memorial for the children of Israel continually.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Israel did as Joshua commanded and picked up twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan, one for each of the tribes of the children of Israel, as the Lord had spoken to Joshua. They crossed over with them to the settlement and set them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua also set twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan at the place where the feet of the priests who carried the ark of the covenant were standing. The stones are there to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests who were carrying the ark stood in the middle of the Jordan until everything was completed that the Lord had commanded Joshua to say to the people, according to all that Moses had commanded Joshua. The people quickly crossed over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people had finished crossing over, the ark of the Lord and the priests crossed over in the presence of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh crossed over in battle formation in front of the children of Israel, according to what Moses had said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About forty thousand battle-ready men crossed over before the Lord for battle on the plains of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day, the Lord honored Joshua in the sight of all Israel. They feared him as they had feared Moses, all the days of his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Joshua,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the priests carrying the ark of the testimony: ‘Come up out of the Jordan!’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua commanded the priests, “Come up out of the Jordan!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when the priests who were carrying the ark of the covenant of the Lord came up from the middle of the Jordan and the soles of the priests’ feet touched the dry ground, the waters of the Jordan returned to their place and overflowed all its banks as before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the people came up from the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month, and they camped at Gilgal, on the eastern border of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua set up in Gilgal those twelve stones that they took from the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the children of Israel, “When your children someday ask their parents, ‘What do these stones mean?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall explain to your children, ‘Israel crossed over the Jordan here on dry ground!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God dried up the waters of the Jordan before you until you crossed over, as the Lord your God did to the Red Sea when He dried it up before us until we crossed over,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that all the peoples of the earth might know the hand of the Lord, that it is mighty, and you would fear the Lord your God always.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the kings of the Amorites west of the Jordan and of the Canaanites by the sea to the east heard that the Lord had dried up the waters of the Jordan before the children of Israel while they crossed over, their hearts melted, and there was no longer any breath in them because of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the Lord said to Joshua, “Make flint knives and circumcise the children of Israel a second time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua made flint knives and circumcised the children of Israel at the Hill of the Foreskins called Gibeath Haaraloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is the reason why Joshua circumcised them: All the males who came out of Egypt who were men of fighting age had died in the wilderness along the way after leaving Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of the people who had come out were circumcised, but all the people born in the wilderness along the way after leaving Egypt were not circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel had traveled forty years in the wilderness until all the people, the men of fighting age who came out of Egypt, died, because they did not obey the Lord. The Lord had sworn not to let them see the land that He had sworn to their fathers to give to us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet He raised up their descendants in their place. These men Joshua circumcised, for they were uncircumcised. They had not been circumcised along the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the entire people was completely circumcised, they stayed where they were in the camp until they healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Joshua, “Today I have rolled away the disgrace of Egypt from upon you.” So the name of that place is called Gilgal even to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel camped in Gilgal and kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the month in the evening on the plains of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The day after the Passover, they ate of the produce of the land, unleavened bread, and roasted grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The manna stopped the day after they ate from the produce of the land, and the children of Israel no longer had manna. That year they ate what the land of Canaan yielded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Joshua was by Jericho, he looked up and saw a man standing in front of him. In His hand was His drawn sword. Joshua went to Him and said, “Are You for us or for our enemies?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Neither, for I am the commander of the army of the Lord. Now I have come.” Then Joshua fell with his face to the ground and worshipped. Then he said, “What does my Lord wish to say to His servant?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The commander of the army of the Lord said to Joshua, “Remove your sandals from your feet, for the place where you are standing is holy.” So Joshua did this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jericho was tightly secured before the children of Israel. There was no one leaving or entering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Joshua, “See, I have given Jericho, its king, and mighty men of valor into your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the men of fighting age shall march around the city. Circle the city once. Do this for six days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven priests shall carry seven ram’s horn trumpets before the ark. On the seventh day, march around the city seven times, with the priests blowing the trumpets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they blow a long blast on the ram’s horn and when you hear the trumpet sound, all the people shall shout a loud battle cry. The walls of the city will fall down, and the people will go up, every man straight ahead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua son of Nun summoned the priests and said to them, “Take up the ark of the covenant. Seven priests bearing seven ram’s horn trumpets shall be in front of the ark of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the people, “Advance and march around the city. Let the armed men pass on before the ark of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Joshua had spoken to the people, the seven priests bearing seven ram’s horn trumpets before the Lord advanced and blew their trumpets. The ark of the covenant of the Lord went after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The armed men went before the priests blowing the trumpets, and the rear guard went after the ark while the trumpets were blowing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joshua had commanded the people, “Do not shout a battle cry, and do not let your voices be heard. Do not let a word come out of your mouths until the time I say to you, ‘Shout the battle cry!’ Then shout.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he had the ark of the Lord circle the city once. Then they came into the camp and spent the night there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua got up early in the morning, and the priests picked up the ark of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven priests bearing seven ram’s horn trumpets before the ark of the Lord moved on, blowing their trumpets continually. The armed men went before them, and the rear guard went after the ark of the Lord while the trumpets were blowing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second day they circled the city once, and they returned to the camp. They did this for six days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then on the seventh day they got up early as dawn was breaking and circled the city in this way seven times. Only on that day did they circle the city seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh time, the priests blew the trumpets and Joshua said to the people, “Shout the battle cry, for the Lord has given you the city!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city and all that is in it are dedicated to the Lord for destruction. Only Rahab the prostitute may live, she, and all who are with her in her house, for she hid the messengers we sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for you, keep yourselves from that which is dedicated for destruction, lest you be destroyed. If you take from that which is dedicated for destruction, you will set the Israelite camp for destruction and bring trouble upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the silver, gold, and bronze and iron articles are set apart for the Lord. They will go into the treasury of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people shouted, and they blew the trumpets. When the people heard the trumpet sound, they shouted a loud battle cry, and the wall fell down. So the people went up into the city, one man after the other, and they captured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They destroyed all that was in the city: man and woman, young and old, and oxen, sheep, and donkey with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet to the two men who had spied out the land, Joshua said, “Enter the prostitute’s house, and bring out the woman and everyone who belongs to her, as you swore to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the young men who had been spies entered and brought out Rahab, her father, her mother, her brothers, everyone who belonged to her, and her whole extended family. They brought them out and placed them outside of the camp of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They burned the city and everything in it with fire. Only the silver, the gold, the bronze and iron articles they gave to the treasury of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet Rahab the prostitute, her father’s family, and everyone who belonged to her, Joshua let live. They live among Israel to this day because she hid the messengers Joshua sent to spy on Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At that time Joshua made them swear, “Cursed before the Lord will be the man who arises and rebuilds this city of Jericho.
He will establish it
    at the cost of his firstborn
and erect its gates
    at the cost of his youngest child.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord was with Joshua, and he became famous throughout the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the children of Israel violated their obligations with regard to the things dedicated for destruction. Achan, son of Karmi, son of Zimri, son of Zerah, from the tribe of Judah took from the things dedicated for destruction, and the anger of the Lord burned against the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai (which is near Beth Aven, east of Bethel) and said to them, “Go up and spy on the land.” So the men went up and spied on Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they returned to Joshua and said to him, “All the people need not go up. Let about two or three thousand men go up and strike Ai. Since they are so few, all the people need not weary themselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So about three thousand men went up from among the people there, but they fled from before the men of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Ai struck down thirty-six men and pursued them from the gate to Shebarim. They struck them down on the mountainside, and the hearts of the people melted like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua ripped his clothes. He and the Israelite elders fell on their faces to the ground in front of the ark of the Lord until evening and threw dirt upon their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said, “O Lord God, why did You bring this people across the Jordan to give us into the hands of the Amorites to destroy us? If only we had been content to dwell on the other side of the Jordan!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O my Lord, what should I say now that Israel has fled before its enemies?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land may hear, turn on us, and cut off our name from the earth. What will You do for Your great name?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Stand up! Why have you fallen on your face?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel has sinned, and they have broken My covenant that I commanded them. They took from the things dedicated for destruction. They have stolen, acted deceitfully, and put them among their own possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the children of Israel cannot stand before their enemies. They turn their backs to their enemies because they have become dedicated for destruction. I will not be with you anymore if you do not destroy the things dedicated for destruction in your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get up! Consecrate the people and say, ‘Consecrate yourselves for tomorrow, for thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: “Things dedicated for destruction are in your midst, O Israel. You are not able to stand before your enemies until you remove the things dedicated for destruction from your midst.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘In the morning you will be brought forward by tribes, and the tribe that the Lord selects by lot shall come forward by clans. The clan that the Lord selects by lot shall come forward by households, and the household that the Lord selects by lot shall come forward man by man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he who is taken with the things dedicated for destruction shall be burned with fire, he and all who belong to him, for he broke the covenant of the Lord and has done a disgraceful action in Israel.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua got up early in the morning and brought forward Israel by their tribes. The tribe of Judah was selected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought forward the clans of Judah, and the clan of the Zerahites was selected. He brought forward the clan of the Zerahites man by man, and Zimri was selected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought forward the household of Zimri man by man, and Achan son of Karmi, son of Zimri, son of Zerah, from the tribe of Judah, was selected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua said to Achan, “O my son, give glory to the Lord, the God of Israel, and give Him praise! Tell me what you have done! Do not hold back anything from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Achan answered Joshua and said, “Indeed, I sinned against the Lord, the God of Israel. This is what I did:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I saw among the plundered goods a beautiful robe from Babylon, two hundred shekels of silver, and a gold bar weighing fifty shekels, I coveted them, so I took them. They are hidden in the ground in my tent. The silver is underneath them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran to the tent. There it all was hidden in the ground with the silver underneath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took it from the tent and brought it to Joshua and all the children of Israel. They spread it out before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua, and all Israel with him, took Achan son of Zerah, the silver, the robe, the gold bar, his sons, his daughters, his oxen, his donkeys, his sheep, his tent, and all he had, and brought them up to the Valley of Achor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Joshua said, “Why have you brought trouble on us? The Lord will trouble you today!”
So all Israel stoned him. They burned them with fire and stoned them with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they erected over him a large pile of stones, which is still there today. So the Lord turned from His burning anger. Therefore the name of the place is called the Valley of Achor to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid or dismayed. Take all the fighting men with you. Arise, and go up to Ai. See, I have given the king of Ai, his people, his city, and his land into your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do to Ai and its king what you did to Jericho and its king, except you may plunder its spoils and its livestock. Now set an ambush for the city behind it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua and all the fighting men arose to go up to Ai. Joshua chose thirty thousand men, mighty men of valor, and sent them out at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded them, “You shall ambush the city from behind. Do not go very far from the city. All of you be ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I and all the people who are with me will approach the city. When they come out to engage us as before, we will flee from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will come after us until we have lured them away from the city, for they will think, ‘They are fleeing from us as before!’ So we will flee from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall rise up for the ambush and take possession of the city. The Lord your God will give it into your hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have seized the city, set it on fire. Act according to the word of the Lord. See, I have commanded you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua sent them out. They went to the place of ambush and took up a position between Bethel and Ai, westward of Ai, and Joshua spent the night among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua got up early in the morning and mustered the people. He and the elders of Israel went up before the people to Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the fighting men who were with him went up and drew near to the city. They camped north of Ai, and there was a valley between them and Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took about five thousand men and set them in ambush between Bethel and Ai, westward of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they stationed the people, all the army that was on the north of the city, and its rear guard on the west of the city, and Joshua spent that night in the midst of the valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the king of Ai saw this, the men of the city hurriedly got up early and went out to engage Israel in battle at the assembly point near the Arabah. Yet he did not know that there was an ambush for him behind the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua and all Israel allowed themselves to be beaten before them, and they fled in the direction of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people who were in Ai were assembled to pursue them, so they pursued Joshua and were drawn away from the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not a man was left in Ai or Bethel who did not go out after Israel. They left the city wide open, and they pursued Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Joshua, “Point toward Ai with the sword that is in your hand, for I will give it into your hand.” So Joshua pointed toward the city with the sword in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his hand pointed, the men in ambush got up quickly from their place and ran. They came into the city, captured it, and quickly set the city on fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Ai turned around and looked, and there from the city came smoke rising to the sky! They could not flee in any direction, and the people who had fled into the wilderness had turned back toward their pursuers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had captured the city and that smoke rose from it, they turned and struck down the men of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men in the city came out to engage them in battle, so they were now in the middle, with Israel on each side. Israel struck them down until neither survivors nor escapees were left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took the king of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Israel completed killing all the inhabitants of Ai in the open wilderness where they had pursued them, and when all of them had finally fallen by the edge of the sword, all Israel returned to Ai and struck it with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who had fallen that day, men and women, numbered twelve thousand, all the people of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua did not draw back his hand with the stretched-out sword until he destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel plundered only the livestock and the spoil of that city for themselves, according to the word of the Lord that He had commanded Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua burned Ai and made it a heap forever, a desolation to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Ai hanged on a tree until evening. At sunset, Joshua commanded that the people take down the body from the tree and throw it down at the city gate. They erected a large heap of stones over it that remains to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua built an altar to the Lord God of Israel on Mount Ebal,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded the children of Israel. As is written in the Book of the Law of Moses, it was “an altar of uncut stones not shaped by iron tools.” They sacrificed burnt offerings to the Lord on it, as well as peace offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There in the presence of the children of Israel he wrote a copy of the Law of Moses on the stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Israel, resident alien and native alike, with its elders, officials, and judges, were standing on either side of the ark in front of the Levite priests carrying the ark of the covenant of the Lord, half in front of Mount Gerizim and half in front of Mount Ebal, as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded from the beginning, in order to bless the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Joshua read out all the words of the law, both blessing and curse, according to all that is written in the Book of the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was not a word from all that Moses had commanded that Joshua did not read out before the whole assembly of Israel, with the women, the children, and the resident aliens who were among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the kings west of the Jordan in the hill country, in the low country, and along all the coast of the Mediterranean Sea toward Lebanon—the Hittite, the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite kings—heard this,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they gathered together as one to wage war against Joshua and Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done to Jericho and Ai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they acted craftily, and took old sacks on their donkeys, and old wineskins, torn and mended,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: old and patched sandals on their feet, and old garments on themselves. All the bread of their provision was dry and crumbly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to Joshua at the Gilgal settlement and said to him and the children of Israel, “We have come from a distant land. Now make a pact with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Israel said to these Hivites, “Perhaps you live among us, so how could we make a pact with you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet they said to Joshua, “We are your slaves.”
Joshua said to them, “Who are you, and where do you come from?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “We, your slaves, have come from a very distant land because of the name of the Lord your God, for we heard news of Him and all He did in Egypt
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all that He did to the two Amorite kings on the other side of the Jordan, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan in Ashtaroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So our elders and all the inhabitants of our country said to us, ‘Take food provisions for the journey and go to meet them. Say to them, “We are your slaves. So now, make a pact with us.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This bread of ours was hot as we took it from our homes on the day we left to come to you, but now, see, it is dry and crumbly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These wineskins that we filled were new, but see, they are ripped open. These clothes and sandals wore out due to the very long journey.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the men examined some of the food provisions, but they did not ask the Lord about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua made peace with them and made a covenant with them to let them live, and the leaders of the congregation swore an oath to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three days after they had made a covenant with them, they heard that they were neighbors to them and lived among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the children of Israel set out and came to their cities on the third day. Their cities were Gibeon, Kephirah, Beeroth, and Kiriath Jearim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the children of Israel did not attack them, for the leaders of the congregation had sworn an oath to them by the Lord, the God of Israel, so the congregation murmured against the leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet all the leaders said to the whole congregation, “We swore to them by the Lord God of Israel, so now we may not harm them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what we will do to them. We will let them live so that wrath will not come upon us due to the oath that we swore to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders of the congregation also said to them, “Let them live!” So they became woodcutters and water carriers for the whole congregation, as the leaders told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua met them and said, “Why did you trick us, saying, ‘We are very distant from you,’ but you are living in our midst?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore now you are cursed, and you will always be slaves, cutting wood and carrying water for the house of my God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered Joshua, “It was told to your slaves that the Lord your God commanded Moses His servant to give you all the land and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land before you. So we were very afraid for our lives, and we did this thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now here we are, in your hands. Do to us whatever is good and right in your eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus he did to them, and delivered them from the hand of the children of Israel; and they did not kill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That day he made them woodcutters and water carriers for the congregation and the altar of the Lord, even to this day, at the place He would choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when King Adoni-Zedek of Jerusalem heard that Joshua captured Ai and destroyed it, doing to Ai and its king as he had done to Jericho and its king, and how the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel and were among them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he and his people were very afraid. Gibeon was a large city, like one of the royal cities. It was larger than Ai, and all its men were warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So King Adoni-Zedek of Jerusalem sent this message to King Hoham of Hebron, King Piram of Jarmuth, King Japhia of Lachish, and King Debir of Eglon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come and help me! Let us attack Gibeon, for it has made peace with Joshua and all the children of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the five kings of the Amorites—the kings of Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish, and Eglon—and all their armies gathered, advanced, and camped against Gibeon. Then they waged war against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Gibeon sent this message to Joshua at the Gilgal settlement: “Do not abandon your slaves. Come up to us quickly. Save us! Help us! For all the Amorite kings living in the hill country have gathered against us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua went up from Gilgal, he and all the people of war with him, and all the mighty men of valor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them, for I have given them into your hand. Not a single man can stand before you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua came upon them suddenly, having marched all night from Gilgal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord panicked them before Israel. They struck them with overwhelming force at Gibeon, then Israel pursued them on the road that rises to Beth Horon and struck them down as far as Azekah and Makkedah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they fled from Israel on the downslope from Beth Horon, the Lord hurled large hailstones down upon them from the sky as far as Azekah. They died, and in fact more died from the hailstones than the children of Israel killed with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So the sun stood still,
    and the moon stood in place
    until the people brought vengeance on their enemies.
Is this not written in the book of Jashar?
The sun stood still in the middle of the sky and did not set for about a full day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There has not been a day like this either before or after it, when the Lord obeyed a man, for the Lord waged war for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua, and all Israel with him, returned to the settlement at Gilgal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet these five kings fled and hid themselves in the cave at Makkedah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua was told, “The five kings have been found hiding themselves in the cave at Makkedah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua said, “Roll large stones over the mouth of the cave, and station men to stand guard over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for you, do not stop pursuing your enemies, but attack them from behind. Do not let them go back to their cities, for the Lord your God has given them into your hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua and the children of Israel had finished striking them with overwhelming force until they were completely defeated, the survivors escaped from them and went back to their fortified cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people returned safely to Joshua at the Makkedah settlement, and no one spoke against any of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said, “Open the mouth of the cave, and bring out to me those five kings from the cave.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did this, and they brought out those five kings from the cave: the kings of Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish, and Eglon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they brought out those five kings to Joshua, he called out to all the men of Israel and the army commanders, “Come here and place your feet on the necks of these kings.” So they came near and placed their feet on their necks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua said to them, “Do not be afraid or dismayed. Be strong and courageous! For this is what the Lord will do to all your enemies against whom you fight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, Joshua struck them down, killed them, and hung them on five trees. They were hanging on the trees until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At sundown Joshua commanded men to take them down from the trees and throw them into the cave in which they had hidden themselves. Over the mouth of the cave he placed large stones, which remain to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua took Makkedah that day and struck it and its king with the edge of the sword. He destroyed it and all life within it. He did not leave any survivors. He did to the king of Makkedah just as he did to the king of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua passed from Makkedah to Libnah with all of Israel, and they fought against Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave Libnah and its king into the hand of Israel, and they struck all who lived in it with the edge of the sword. There were no survivors left. They did to its king what they had done to the king of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua passed from Libnah to Lachish with all of Israel, camped against it, and waged war against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave Lachish into the hand of Israel. They captured it on the second day and struck all who lived in it with the edge of the sword, just as they had done to Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Horam of Gezer came up to help Lachish, but Joshua attacked him and his people until he did not have a single survivor left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Lachish, Joshua and all of Israel passed to Eglon. They camped against it and waged war against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They captured it that day and struck it with the edge of the sword. All who lived in it were destroyed that day, just as Israel had done to Lachish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua and all of Israel went up from Eglon to Hebron and waged war against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They captured it and struck its king, and all who lived in it, and its surrounding towns with the edge of the sword. No survivor was left. Just as they had done to Eglon, they destroyed it and all who lived in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua and all of Israel turned to Debir and waged war against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They captured it, its king, and all its surrounding towns and struck them with the edge of the sword. They destroyed all who lived in them, and no survivor was left. As he had done to Hebron, so he did to Debir and its king as they had done to Libnah and its king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua attacked the whole land: the hill country, the Negev, the lowlands, the mountain slopes, and all their kings. No survivor was left. He destroyed all who breathed, as the Lord God of Israel had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua attacked the land from Kadesh Barnea to Gaza and the land of Goshen as far as Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua captured all these kings and their land in one campaign because the Lord God of Israel waged war for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua and all of Israel returned to the settlement at Gilgal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When King Jabin of Hazor heard these things, he sent word to King Jobab of Madon, the king of Shimron, the king of Akshaph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the kings of the northern hill country, the Arabah south of Kinnereth, the low country, and the heights of Dor in the west,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the Canaanites in the east and in the west, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites in the hill country, and the Hivites at Mount Hermon in the land of Mizpah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So these kings went out with all their armies, people as numerous as grains of sand on the seashore, with a large number of horses and chariots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These kings all met and camped together at the waters of Merom in order to wage war against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them, for about this time tomorrow I will make them dead before Israel. Hamstring their horses and burn their chariots with fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua and all his fighting forces came upon them by surprise at the waters of Merom and fell upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave them into the hand of Israel. They struck them down and pursued them all the way to Greater Sidon, Misrephoth Maim, and Mizpah Valley to the east. They struck them down until no survivor remained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua did to them as the Lord had said. He hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Joshua turned, captured Hazor, and struck down its king with the sword. Hazor was formerly the head of all these kingdoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They struck all who lived in them with the edge of the sword, destroying them. No one who breathed was left, and he burned Hazor with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua captured all these kings and their towns. He struck with the edge of the sword, destroying them, as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, Israel did not burn any of the cities that stood on mounds except Hazor. Joshua burned it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel plundered all the goods and the livestock of these cities, but they struck all the people with the edge of the sword until they destroyed them. They did not spare anyone who breathed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the Lord commanded Moses His servant, so Moses commanded Joshua, and Joshua did it. He did not ignore a word of all that the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua took all that land: the hill country, the Negev, all the land of Goshen, the lowland, the Arabah, the hill country of Israel and its lowland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Mount Halak to Seir, and as far as Baal Gad in the Lebanon Valley under Mount Hermon: All their kings he captured, struck down, and killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua engaged all those kings in battle for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was no city that made peace with the children of Israel except the Hivites living in Gibeon. They conquered all of them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the Lord hardened their hearts to engage Israel in battle. They destroyed them without mercy, to put them to death, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Joshua came and wiped out the Anakites from the hill country: from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab, from all the hill country of Judah, and from all the hill country of Israel. Joshua utterly destroyed them and their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No Anakites were left in the land of the children of Israel, but they did remain in Gaza, Gath, and Ashdod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua took the whole land according to all that the Lord had said to Moses. Joshua gave it to Israel as an inheritance according to their allotted portions by their tribes. Then the land rested from war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the kings on the east side of the Jordan, from the River Arnon to Mount Hermon and all the eastern Arabah, whom the children of Israel struck down to take over their land:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon and ruled from Aroer, which is on the bank of River Arnon, and from the middle of the valley as far as the River Jabbok, which is the border of the Ammonites, that is, half of Gilead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Arabah to the Sea of Galilee eastward, and toward Beth Jeshimoth, to the Sea of Arabah, the Dead Sea, southward below the slopes of Pisgah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Og king of Bashan, one of the remnant of the giants, who lived at Ashtaroth and at Edrei
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ruled over Mount Hermon, Salekah, and all of Bashan to the border of the Geshurites and the Maakathites, and over half of Gilead to the border of Sihon king of Heshbon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses the servant of the Lord and the children of Israel struck them down, and the servant of the Lord Moses gave their land to Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the kings of the land whom Joshua and the children of Israel defeated on the west side of the Jordan, from Baal Gad in the Valley of Lebanon to Mount Halak, that rises toward Seir. Joshua gave their land to the tribes of Israel according to their allotted portions as an inheritance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the hill country, in the lowland, in the Arabah, in the slopes, in the wilderness, and in the Negev—the land of the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king of Jericho, one;
the king of Ai, which is beside Bethel, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Jerusalem, one;
the king of Hebron, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Jarmuth, one;
the king of Lachish, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Eglon, one;
the king of Gezer, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Debir, one;
the king of Geder, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Hormah, one;
the king of Arad, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Libnah, one;
the king of Adullam, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Makkedah, one;
the king of Bethel, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Tappuah, one;
the king of Hepher, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Aphek, one;
the king of Lasharon, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Madon, one;
the king of Hazor, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Shimron Meron, one;
the king of Akshaph, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Taanach, one;
the king of Megiddo, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Kedesh, one;
the king of Jokneam in Carmel, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Dor in Naphoth Dor, one;
the king of the people in Gilgal, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Tirzah, one—thirty-one kings in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joshua was old and well advanced in years. The Lord said to him, “You are old and advanced in years, but very much of the land still remains to be possessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the land that remains: all the districts of the Philistines and those of the Geshurites
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (from the Shihor east of Egypt northward to the boundary of Ekron, which is counted as Canaanite; the cities of the five Philistine governors: Gaza, Ashdod, Ashkelon, Gath, and Ekron), and also the Avvites’ lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also remaining in the south is all the land of the Canaanites, Arah owned by the Sidonians, as far as Aphek at the Amorite boundary,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the land of the Gebalites and all Lebanon to the east, and from Baal Gad at the foot of Mount Hermon to Lebo Hamath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will drive out from before the children of Israel all the inhabitants of the hill country from Lebanon to Misrephoth Maim and all the Sidonians. Be sure to divide these lands by lot as an inheritance for Israel as I have commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, divide this land as an inheritance for the nine tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the other half-tribe of Manasseh, Reuben and Gad took their inheritance that Moses gave to them on the east side of the Jordan, as Moses the servant of the Lord had given them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Aroer on the bank of the River Arnon, the city in the middle of the valley, all the plain from Medeba to Dibon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the cities of King Sihon of the Amorites who reigned in Heshbon, and the land up to the Ammonite border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses had also given them Gilead, the territory of the Geshurites and Maakathites, all of Mount Hermon, and all of Bashan as far as Salekah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in Bashan all the kingdom of Og, one of the last remnant of the giants, who reigned in Ashtaroth and Edrei. Moses struck them down and took their lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the children of Israel did not drive out the Geshurites or the Maakathites, and Geshur and Maakah live among Israel until this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However Moses did not give an inheritance to the tribe of Levi. The burnt offerings of the Lord God of Israel are their inheritance, as He said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses assigned land to the tribe of the Reubenites according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory was from Aroer on the edge of the Arnon Valley, the city in the middle of the valley, all the plain of Medeba,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heshbon and all its towns in the plain: Dibon, Bamoth Baal, Beth Baal Meon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jahaz, Kedemoth, Mephaath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kiriathaim, Sibmah, Zereth Shahar on the hill of the valley,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth Peor, the slopes of Pisgah, Beth Jeshimoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the cities of the plain, and the whole kingdom of King Sihon of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon. Moses struck him down along with the leaders of Midian, Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, who were princes of Sihon who lived in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel killed Balaam son of Beor, who practiced divination, with the sword along with the rest of the slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border of the Reubenites was the banks of the Jordan. This was the inheritance of the Reubenites according to their clans: those towns and their settlements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses assigned land to the tribe of Gad for the Gadites according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory was Jazer, all the cities of Gilead, and half of the Ammonite land as far as Aroer, which is east of Rabbah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Heshbon to Ramath Mizpah, Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the territory of Debir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the valley were Beth Haram, Beth Nimrah, Sukkoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of King Sihon of Heshbon, the Jordan as its boundary to the lower Sea of Galilee to the east of the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the inheritance of the Gadites according to their clans: those towns and their settlements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses assigned land to the half-tribe of Manasseh for the descendants of Manasseh according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory was from Mahanaim, through all of Bashan, all the kingdom of King Og of Bashan, all the sixty villages of Jair that are in Bashan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: half of Gilead, Ashtaroth, and Edrei: cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan. This was for the descendants of Makir son of Manasseh, half of the descendants of Makir by their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the territory Moses assigned in the desert plains of Moab, on the eastern side of Jericho and the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet Moses did not assign land to the tribe of Levi as an inheritance. The Lord God of Israel was their inheritance, as He said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the territories that the children of Israel inherited in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the family leaders of the Israelite tribes assigned to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their inheritance fell to them by lot, as the Lord commanded through Moses, for the nine and a half tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses had assigned the inheritance of two and a half tribes on the other side of the Jordan, but he had not assigned an inheritance among them to the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Joseph were two tribes: Manasseh and Ephraim. They did not give territory to the Levites in the land, but only towns in which to live, along with the pastures, livestock, and property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as the Lord had commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did when they divided the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Judah approached Joshua at Gilgal, and Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him, “You know what the Lord said to Moses the man of God about you and me at Kadesh Barnea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was forty years old when Moses the servant of the Lord sent me from Kadesh Barnea to spy on the land, and I brought word back to him as it was in my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My companions who went up with me made the hearts of the people melt, but I wholeheartedly followed after the Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day Moses swore an oath, ‘The land on which your foot treads shall be your inheritance, for your descendants perpetually, because you completely followed after the Lord my God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now, the Lord has kept me alive, just as He said, for forty-five years, since the Lord spoke this word to Moses while Israel wandered in the wilderness. Now, here I am this day, eighty-five years old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am still just as strong today as I was on the day that Moses sent me. My strength now is just like my strength then, both for battle and for going out and returning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, give me this hill country that the Lord spoke about on that day. That day you heard that the Anakites live there in large, fortified cities. Perhaps the Lord will be with me, and I will drive them out, as the Lord said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua blessed him and gave Hebron to Caleb son of Jephunneh as an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Hebron became an inheritance of Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite until this day because he completely followed after the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The former name of Hebron was Kiriath Arba. Arba was the greatest man among the Anakites.
Then the land had rest from war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The allotment for the tribe of Judah, by their clans, stretches southward to the border of Edom, to the Zin wilderness in the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their southern border runs from the southern tip of the Salt Sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to south of the Ascent of Akrabbim, crosses to Zin, rises south of Kadesh Barnea, crosses to Hezron, then rises to Addar, turns toward Karka,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then crosses to Azmon, goes out to the Brook of Egypt, and then to the sea. This is your southern border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eastern border is the Salt Sea up to the mouth of the Jordan.
The northern border runs from the northern extremity of the Dead Sea at the mouth of the Jordan River,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then rises to Beth Hoglah, crosses north of Beth Arabah, rises to the Stone of Bohan son of Reuben,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and rises to Debir from the Achor Valley, turns northward to Gilgal opposite the Ascent of Adummim south of the valley, and crosses to the waters of En Shemesh and onward to En Rogel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border rises to Valley of Ben Hinnom, to the southern slope of the Jebusites (that is, Jerusalem), then rises to the top of the hill west of the Valley of Ben Hinnom, at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border turns from the top of the hill to the waters of Nephtoah and goes out to the cities of Mount Ephron, then turns to Baalah (that is, Kiriath Jearim).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border turns west of Baalah to Mount Seir, crosses to the northern slope of Mount Jearim (that is, Kesalon), descends to Beth Shemesh, and crosses to Timnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border goes out to the northern slope of Ekron, turns to Shikkeron, crosses to Mount Baalah, goes out to Jabneel, and ends at the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The western border was the coastline of the Mediterranean Sea.
These were the borders surrounding the tribe of Judah according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the word of the Lord to Joshua, Caleb son of Jephunneh was given an allotment among the tribe of Judah: Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron). Arba was the father of Anak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caleb drove out from there three Anakites: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, descendants of Anak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went up from there against the inhabitants of Debir. Before the name of Debir was Kiriath Sepher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caleb said, “I will give my daughter Aksah in marriage to whoever attacks Kiriath Sepher and captures it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Othniel son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb, captured it, so Caleb gave him Aksah his daughter in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she came to Othniel, she urged him to ask her father for a field. She dismounted from her donkey, and Caleb said to her, “What can I do for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She answered, “Please give me a blessing. Since you have given me land in the Negev, now give me springs of water.” So he gave her the upper and lower springs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of Judah according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities at the southern extremity of the tribe of Judah toward the border with Edom were Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazor Hadattah, Kerioth Hezron (that is, Hazor),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amam, Shema, Moladah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar Gaddah, Heshmon, Beth Pelet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar Shual, Beersheba, Biziothiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baalah, Iyim, Ezem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eltolad, Kesil, Hormah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon. The cities numbered twenty-nine with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the lowland were Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zanoah, En Gannim, Tappuah, Enam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jarmuth, Adullam, Sokoh, Azekah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shaaraim, Adithaim, Gederah (Gederothaim): fourteen cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also there were Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal Gad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dilean, Mizpah, Joktheel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kabbon, Lahmas, Kitlish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gederoth, Beth Dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah: sixteen cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also there were Libnah, Ether, Ashan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iphtah, Ashnah, Nezib,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keilah, Akzib, and Mareshah: nine cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also there were Ekron, its towns and villages;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Ekron to the sea, all the land near Ashdod and their villages,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ashdod, its towns and villages, Gaza, its towns and villages, as far as the Brook of Egypt and the Mediterranean Sea with its coast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the hill country were Shamir, Jattir, Sokoh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dannah, Kiriath Sannah (that is, Debir),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Goshen, Holon, and Giloh: eleven cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also there were Arab, Dumah, Eshan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Janim, Beth Tappuah, Aphekah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Humtah, Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron), and Zior: nine cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also there were Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Juttah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jezreel, Jokdeam, Zanoah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah: ten cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also there were Halhul, Beth Zur, Gedor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Maarath, Beth Anoth, and Eltekon: six cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also there were Kiriath Baal (that is, Kiriath Jearim) and Rabbah: two cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the wilderness were Beth Arabah, Middin, Sekakah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nibshan, City of Salt, and En Gedi: six cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Judah were not able to drive out the Jebusites living in Jerusalem, so the Jebusites live with the people of Judah in Jerusalem to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The allotment of land for the descendants of Joseph was from the Jordan by Jericho then east into the wilderness, rising from Jericho to the hill country of Bethel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It goes out from Bethel to Luz and passes to the border of Arkite territory at Ataroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It goes down westward to the territory of the Japhletites, to the border of lower Beth Horon and Gezer, and then goes out to the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the descendants of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, took their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The territory of the Ephraimites, according to their clans, was as follows. The border of their inheritance on the east was Ataroth Addar as far as upper Beth Horon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border goes out toward the sea with Mikmethath on the north. It turns eastward toward Taanath Shiloh and passes it on the east toward Janoah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It descends from Janoah to Ataroth and to Naarah, touches Jericho, and extends to the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Tappuah the border goes west to the Kanah Ravine and out to the sea. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the Ephraimites according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other cities for the Ephraimites were in the middle of the inheritance of the descendants of Manasseh, all the cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer, so the Canaanites live in the midst of Ephraim until this day performing heavy labor as slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then allotment was made to the tribe of Manasseh, for he was the firstborn of Joseph. To Makir the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead, were allotted Gilead and Bashan, because he was a warrior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And allotments were made to the rest of the tribe of Manasseh, according to their families: Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, and Shemida; these were the male descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph, according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet Zelophehad, son of Hepher, son of Gilead, son of Makir, son of Manasseh had no sons, only daughters. These were his daughters’ names: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milkah, and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They approached Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leaders, saying, “The Lord commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our relatives.” So Joshua gave them an inheritance among their fathers’ relatives according to the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Manasseh received ten regions, apart from the lands of Gilead and Bashan on the east side of the Jordan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the daughters of Manasseh received an inheritance among his sons, and the rest of the people of Manasseh received the land of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The boundary of Manasseh was from Asher to Mikmethath east of Shechem, and it runs south toward the inhabitants of En Tappuah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Manasseh owned the land of Tappuah, but Tappuah on the border of Manasseh belonged to the Ephraimites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the border descended to the Kanah Ravine, southward to the brook. These cities of Ephraim are among the cities of Manasseh. The border of Manasseh was on the north side of the brook, and it ended at the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land belonging to Ephraim was to the south, and the land belonging to Manasseh to the north. The Mediterranean Sea was the boundary of this territory, which bordered Asher in the north and Issachar in the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Issachar and Asher, Manasseh was assigned districts: Beth Shan, Ibleam, Dor, Endor, Taanach, Megiddo, Naphoth, and their respective villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the sons of Manasseh could not take possession of those cities, because the Canaanites were determined to live in that land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the children of Israel became strong, they put the Canaanites to hard labor as slaves, but they did not actually drive them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Joseph said to Joshua, “Why have you assigned us a single allotment, a single portion? We are a numerous people, as the Lord has blessed us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to them, “If you are a numerous people, go up to the forests and clear out a place there for yourselves in the land of the Perizzites and the giants, since the hill country of Ephraim is too small for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Joseph said, “The hill country is not enough for us, and all the Canaanites living in the plains have iron chariots, both those in Beth Shan and the Jezreel Valley.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to Ephraim and Manasseh, the descendants of Joseph, “You are a numerous people who have great strength. There will not be only one allotment for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hill country shall be yours. Although it is a forest you shall clear it and own it to its borders. You shall drive out the Canaanites, even though they have iron chariots and are strong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole congregation of the children of Israel assembled at Shiloh and set up the tent of meeting there. The land was subdued before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet seven tribes among the children of Israel remained who had not yet received their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua said to the children of Israel, “How long will you delay going in to possess the land that the Lord, the God of your fathers, has given you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Select three men from each tribe, and I will send them out; and they will rise and go throughout the land, and describe it according to their inheritance, and they will come back to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall divide it into seven portions. Judah will stay in their territory in the south, and the house of Joseph will stay in their territory in the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So describe the land in seven portions and return to me. Then I will cast lots for you here before the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet there is no portion for the Levites among you, for the priesthood of the Lord is their inheritance. Gad, Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have acquired their inheritance on the east side of the Jordan, which Moses the servant of the Lord gave them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the men got up and left. Joshua commanded those who were leaving to survey the land, saying, “Go and walk back and forth throughout the land. Write a description of it, then return to me. Here in Shiloh I will cast lots for you before the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
