verses.text: The men went and passed through the land. In a book they wrote a description of it by cities in seven portions, and they came back to Joshua at the Shiloh settlement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua cast lots for them in Shiloh before the Lord. There Joshua apportioned the land for the children of Israel according to their divisions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot of the tribe of Benjamin, according to their clans, came up. The territory allotted to it fell between Judah and Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their northern border goes from the Jordan up the northern slope of Jericho. It runs westward into the hill country and extends to the wilderness of Beth Aven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border passes from there southward toward Luz, to the slope of Luz (that is, Bethel), and descends to Ataroth Addar on the hill south of lower Beth Horon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the western side, the border turns south from the hill that lies to the south near Beth Horon, and it extends to Kiriath Baal (that is, Kiriath Jearim), a city belonging to Judah. This is the western border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The southern border starts from Kiriath Jearim and goes out westward to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border then descends to the foot of the mountain that lies by the Valley of Ben Hinnom, which is at the north end of the Valley of Rephaim. It descends from the Hinnom Valley to the slope of the Jebusites, then down to En Rogel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border runs north and goes out to En Shemesh and Geliloth, which is opposite the Ascent of Adummim, and descends to the Stone of Bohan the son of Reuben.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It passes toward the slope north of the Beth Arabah and descends to the Arabah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border passes north of the slope of Beth Hoglah, and it runs out to the northern tip of the Dead Sea at the southern end of the Jordan. This is the southern border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Jordan forms the eastern boundary.
This is the inheritance of the tribe of Benjamin, according to their clans, by its boundaries all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities belonging to the tribe of Benjamin, according to their clans, were Jericho, Beth Hoglah, Emek Keziz,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth Arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Avvim, Parah, Ophrah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kephar Ammoni, Ophni, and Geba: twelve cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also there were Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mizpah, Kephirah, Mozah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zelah, Haeleph, the Jebusite city (that is, Jerusalem), Gibeah, and Kiriath: fourteen cities with their villages.
This is the inheritance of the tribe of Benjamin according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second lot came out for Simeon, for the tribe of Simeon according to their clans. Their inheritance was within the inheritance of the tribe of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their inheritance was Beersheba, Sheba, Moladah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar Shual, Balah, Ezem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziklag, Beth Markaboth, Hazar Susah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth Lebaoth, and Sharuhen: thirteen cities and their villages;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ain, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan: four cities and their villages;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and all the villages that were around these cities as far as Baalath Beer, Ramah of the Negev.
This was the inheritance of the tribe of Simeon according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon received a portion of the inheritance of Judah, for the inheritance of Judah was too large for them, so Simeon inherited land in the midst of the inheritance of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third lot came up for Zebulun according to their clans. Their territory extended to Sarid,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their border ascended westward to Maralah, reaching Dabbesheth and the valley east of Jokneam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Sarid the border turned east to the border of Kisloth Tabor, out to Daberath, and up to Japhia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there it passes east to Gath Hepher and Eth Kazin. It turns out to Rimmon and turns toward Neah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The boundary turns north to Hannathon and extends to the Valley of Iphtah El;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Kattath, Nahalal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem: twelve cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the inheritance of the tribe of Zebulun according to their clans: these cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth lot came out for Issachar, for the tribe of Issachar according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory included Jezreel, Kesulloth, Shunem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hapharaim, Shion, Anaharath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rabbith, Kishion, Ebez,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remeth, En Gannim, En Haddah, and Beth Pazzez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border touches Tabor, Shahazumah, and Beth Shemesh, then extends to the Jordan: sixteen cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of Issachar according to their clans: the cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth lot came out for the tribe of Asher according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory included Helkath, Hali, Beten, Akshaph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Allammelek, Amad, and Mishal. On the west their border touches Carmel and Shihor Libnath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it turns eastward, goes to Beth Dagon, and touches Zebulun and the Valley of Iphtah El northward to Beth Emek and Neiel; then it continues in the north to Kabul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abdon, Rehob, Hammon, Kanah, as far as Greater Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the border turned to Ramah, reaching the fortified city of Tyre. Then the border turned to Hosah, and ended at the Mediterranean Sea by the region of Akzib,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ummah, Aphek, and Rehob: twenty-two cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of Asher according to their clans: these cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth lot came out for the tribe of Naphtali according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their border runs from Heleph, from the oak of Zaanannim, to Adami Nekeb and Jabneel, as far as Lakkum, and extends to the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border turns west to Aznoth Tabor, goes out from there to Hukkok, and touches Zebulun on the south, Asher on the west, and Judah at the Jordan on the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their fortified cities were Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Kinnereth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adamah, Ramah, Hazor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedesh, Edrei, En Hazor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iron, Migdal El, Horem, Beth Anath, and Beth Shemesh: nineteen cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of Naphtali according to their clans: the cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh lot came out for the tribe of Dan according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The territory of their inheritance included Zorah, Eshtaol, Ir Shemesh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Ithlah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elon, Timnah, Ekron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehud, Bene Berak, Gath Rimmon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Me Jarkon, and Rakkon, along with the territory near Joppa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the tribe of Dan lost their territory, so they went up to wage war against Leshem and captured it. They attacked it with the edge of the sword, took possession of it, and settled there. They called Leshem Dan after the name of Dan their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of Dan according to their clans: these cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had finished allotting the land according to its boundaries, the children of Israel gave an inheritance among them to Joshua son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the word of the Lord, they gave him the city for which he asked: Timnath Serah in the hill country of Ephraim. He built up the city and lived in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the inheritances that Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the family leaders of the Israelite tribes assigned by lot in Shiloh before the Lord at the entrance of the tent of meeting. So they completed dividing the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Joshua,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to the children of Israel, ‘Choose refuge cities, as I told you through Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that anyone who kills a person without intent and unknowingly may flee there. They shall be your refuge from the avenger of blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘The refugee can flee to one of these cities then stand at the entrance of the city gate and tell his case to the city elders. They will take him into the city and give him a place to stay, and he will live with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the avenger of blood comes after him, they shall not hand over the manslayer to him, for he struck down his neighbor unintentionally with no premeditated malice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall live in that city until he stands before the congregation for judgment, until the death of the high priest serving at that time. Then the manslayer may return to his home and to his city from which he had fled.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They selected Kedesh in Galilee in the hill country of Naphtali, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron) in the hill country of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Across the Jordan east of Jericho, they selected Bezer in the wilderness plain from the tribe of Reuben, Ramoth in Gilead from the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan from the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the cities designated for all the children of Israel and resident foreigners living among them, to which anyone who killed someone inadvertently could flee and not die at the hand of the avenger of blood until he stood before the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The family leaders of the Levites approached Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the family leaders of the Israelite tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At Shiloh in the land of Canaan they said to them, “Through Moses the Lord commanded that we be given cities in which to live and grazing lands for our livestock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So according to the word of the Lord, out of their inheritance the children of Israel gave the Levites these cities and their grazing lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot came out for the clans of the Kohathites, so the Levites who were descendants of Aaron received an allotment of thirteen cities from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The remaining descendants of Kohath received an allotment of ten cities from the clans of the tribes of Ephraim, Dan, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Gershon received an allotment of thirteen cities from the clans of the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Merari by their clans received an allotment of twelve cities from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel allotted the Levites these cities and their grazing lands, as the Lord commanded through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribes of Judah and Simeon they assigned the following cities with these names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were assigned to the descendants of Aaron, to the clans of the Kohathites of the tribe of Levi, for theirs was the first lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They assigned them Kiriath Arba (Arba was the father of Anak), which is Hebron, in the hill country of Judah, and the grazing lands around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now they had assigned the city’s fields and its surrounding villages to Caleb son of Jephunneh as his property.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So to the descendants of Aaron the priest they assigned Hebron (a refuge city for people who committed manslaughter), Libnah with its pastures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jattir, Eshtemoa,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Holon, Debir,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ain, Juttah, and Beth Shemesh, together with the grazing lands of each: nine cities from these two tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Benjamin they assigned Gibeon, Geba,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anathoth, and Almon, together with the grazing lands of each: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether the descendants of Aaron received thirteen cities and their grazing lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the Levites from the clans of the descendants of Kohath received cities allotted from the tribe of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They assigned them Shechem (a refuge city for people who committed manslaughter) in the hill country of Ephraim, Gezer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kibzaim, and Beth Horon, together with the grazing lands of each: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Dan they assigned Eltekeh, Gibbethon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aijalon, and Gath Rimmon, together with the grazing lands of each: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the half-tribe of Manasseh they assigned Taanach and Gath Rimmon, together with the grazing lands of each: two cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether the rest of the clans of the descendants of Kohath received ten cities and their grazing lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the half-tribe of Manasseh they assigned to the descendants of Gershon (one of the Levite clans): Golan in Bashan (a refuge city for people who committed manslaughter) and Be Eshterah, together with the grazing lands of each: two cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Issachar they assigned Kishion, Daberath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jarmuth, and En Gannim, together with the grazing lands of each: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Asher they assigned Mishal, Abdon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Helkath, and Rehob, together with the grazing lands of each: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Naphtali they assigned Kedesh in Galilee (a refuge city for people who committed manslaughter), Hammoth Dor, and Kartan, together with the grazing lands of each: three cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether the Gershonites according to their clans received thirteen cities and their grazing lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Zebulun they assigned to the descendants of Merari (the remaining Levites): Jokneam, Kartah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dimnah, and Nahalal, together with the grazing lands of each: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Reuben they assigned Bezer, Jahaz,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedemoth, and Mephaath, together with the grazing lands of each: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Gad they assigned Ramoth in Gilead (a refuge city for people who committed manslaughter), Mahanaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heshbon, and Jazer, together with the grazing lands of each: four cities in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So twelve cities were allotted for the descendants of Merari according to their clans (the remaining Levite clans).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether the Levites received forty-eight cities and their grazing lands within the possessions of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of these cities had grazing lands surrounding them. It was this way with all these cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave Israel all the land that He swore to give to their fathers. They took possession of it and lived in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave them rest all around, according to all that He swore to their fathers. Not a man among their enemies stood before them, and the Lord delivered all their enemies into their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not a single word of all the good things that the Lord had spoken to the children of Israel failed. They all came to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua summoned the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You have done everything that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you and have obeyed me in everything that I have commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have not left your brothers these many days down to this day, and you have observed the obligations of the commandment of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord your God has given rest to your brothers, as He had said to them. So now, turn and go to your homes, to the land of your possession, which Moses the servant of the Lord gave you on the other side of the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only carefully obey the commandment and the law that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you: to love the Lord your God, to walk in all His ways, to obey His commandments, to cling to Him, and to serve Him with all your heart and soul.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua blessed them and sent them off, and they went to their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses had assigned land in Bashan to half the tribe of Manasseh, and to the other half Joshua assigned land among their brothers on the west side of the Jordan. When Joshua sent them also to their homes and blessed them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said, “Return home with great wealth, much livestock, silver, gold, copper, iron, and great quantities of clothing. Divide the spoil of your enemies among your brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Reubenites, Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh left the children of Israel at Shiloh in the land of Canaan to go to the land of Gilead, the land of their possession, according to the word of the Lord through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh came near the Jordan in the land of Canaan and built a very large altar by the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel heard someone say, “The tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar by the land of Canaan by the Jordan on the Israelite side.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the children of Israel heard this, they assembled the whole congregation of the children of Israel at Shiloh to go up against them in war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Israel sent Phinehas, son of Eleazar the priest, to the sons of Reuben, to the sons of Gad, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh, into the land of Gilead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with him ten chiefs, one chief each for each father’s household of every tribe of Israel; and each one of them was the head of his father’s house among the thousands of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The whole congregation of the Lord says, ‘What is this trespass you have committed against the God of Israel? Today you have turned from following the Lord by building yourselves an altar to rebel against Him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is the sin of Peor, from which we have still not purified ourselves even today, not enough for us, which brought a plague upon the congregation of the Lord
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that today you have turned away from following the Lord?
“ ‘If today you are rebelling against the Lord, then tomorrow He will be angry with the whole congregation of Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If indeed your own land is unclean, then cross over to the land of the Lord where the tabernacle of the Lord stands and take land among us. Yet do not rebel against the Lord or rebel against us by building an altar other than the altar of the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did not Achan son of Zerah commit a trespass in the things under the ban, and wrath fall on all the congregation of Israel? And that man did not perish alone in his iniquity.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh answered and said to the heads of the Israelite clans,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord God of gods, the Lord God of gods, He knows, and may Israel know—if we have acted in rebellion or disloyalty against the Lord, do not spare us today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we have built an altar to turn away from following the Lord, to offer burnt offerings and grain offerings or make peace offerings upon it, may the Lord Himself demand an account.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We did this deed because we were worried that in the future your descendants might say, ‘What have you to do with the Lord God of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord made the Jordan a boundary between us and you, the descendants of Reuben and Gad. You have no share in the Lord!’ In this way your descendants might make our descendants to stop worshipping the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So we said to each other, ‘Let us build this altar, not for burnt offering or sacrifice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but as a witness for us, for you, and for the generations after us, that we may perform the service of the Lord before Him with our burnt offerings, sacrifices, and peace offerings, and in the future your descendants will not be able to say to our descendants, “You have no share in the Lord!” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore we said, ‘In the future, if they say this to us or to our descendants, we will say, “Look at the replica of the altar of the Lord that our fathers made, not for burnt offerings or sacrifices, but as a witness between you and us.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “God forbid that we should rebel against the Lord by turning from following the Lord today by building an altar for burnt offerings, grain offerings, and sacrifices other than the altar of the Lord God that stands before His tabernacle!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Phinehas the priest, the leaders of the congregation, and the heads of the Israelite clans who were with him heard what the descendants of Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh said, it pleased them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest said to the descendants of Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh, “Today we know that the Lord is in our midst because you did not violate your obligations to the Lord in this matter. Indeed, you have delivered the children of Israel from the judgment of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest and the leaders returned from meeting the descendants of Reuben and Gad in the land of Gilead to the children of Israel in the land of Canaan. They brought back a report.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This report was good in the eyes of the children of Israel, and the children of Israel blessed God. They decided not to make war against the descendants of Reuben and Gad to ruin the land in which they lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Reuben and Gad named the altar Witness, “For it is a witness between us that the Lord is God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A long time later, after the Lord had given Israel rest from all their enemies around them, Joshua was old and advanced in years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua called for all Israel, their elders, clan heads, judges, and officials, and said to them, “I am old and advanced in years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have seen all that the Lord your God did to all these peoples before you, for it is the Lord your God who has waged war for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I have allotted to you as an inheritance the land of these peoples who remain, along with the land of the peoples whom I defeated, from the Jordan to the Mediterranean Sea in the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will drive them out and dispossess them from before you, and you will inherit their land, as the Lord your God told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now be very strong to observe and enact all that is written in the Book of the Law of Moses, so that you do not deviate from it to the right or the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not assimilate with these peoples remaining among you. Do not invoke the names of their gods, nor swear by, serve, or worship them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, cling to the Lord your God, as you have done until today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Lord has dispossessed before you great and mighty peoples, and as for you, not a single man has been able to stand against you until today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One man from among you can make a thousand flee, for it is the Lord your God who wages war for you, as He told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now be careful, therefore, to love the Lord your God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For if you should turn and cling to the remainder of these peoples who are left with you, and you intermarry and assimilate with them, and they with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: know for certain that the Lord your God will no longer drive out these nations from before you. But they shall be snares and traps to you, a whip on your sides and thorns in your eyes, until you perish from off this good ground that the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now, I am going the way of all the earth. You know in all your hearts and souls that not a single word has failed out of all the good things that the Lord your God has said concerning you. All came true for you. Not a single word among them failed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So just as every good thing that the Lord your God said to you came to be, even so the Lord can bring every bad thing upon you until He has destroyed you from this good land that the Lord your God gave you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you break the covenant of the Lord your God that He commanded you, and go and serve other gods and worship them, the anger of the Lord will burn against you, and you will quickly perish from the good land that He gave you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua called for all the Israelite tribes at Shechem and summoned the elders, clan heads, judges, and officials of Israel. They presented themselves before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to all the people, “Thus says the Lord God of Israel: Long ago your fathers—Terah father of Abraham and Nahor—lived beyond the Euphrates and served other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I took your father Abraham from beyond the Euphrates, brought him through all the land of Canaan, and gave him many descendants. To him I gave Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau, and to Esau I gave Mount Seir for his inheritance, but Jacob and his descendants went down into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I sent Moses and Aaron, I struck Egypt down with all I did in their midst, and afterward I brought you out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I brought your fathers out of Egypt, then you came to the sea. The Egyptians pursued your fathers with chariots and horsemen to the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your fathers cried out to the Lord, and He placed darkness between you and the Egyptians. He made the sea come upon them and cover them. Your own eyes saw what I did to Egypt, and you lived in the wilderness a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I brought you to the land of the Amorites who lived on the other side of the Jordan. They waged war against you, but I gave them into your hand so that you might inherit their land, and I destroyed them before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab, arose and waged war against Israel. He called for Balaam son of Beor to curse you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I refused to listen to Balaam. Therefore he blessed you still, and I delivered you out of his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You crossed the Jordan and came to Jericho. The leaders of Jericho, along with the Amorites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hittites, Girgashites, Hivites, and Jebusites, waged war against you, but I gave them into your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I sent the hornet and drove out the two Amorite kings from before you, but not with your sword or your bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave you a land for which you did not work, and cities that you did not build. You live in them, and you are eating from the produce of vineyards and olive groves you did not plant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now fear the Lord, and serve Him with sincerity and faithfulness. Put away the gods your fathers served beyond the River and in Egypt. Serve the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is displeasing to you to serve the Lord, then choose today whom you will serve, if it should be the gods your fathers served beyond the River or the gods of the Amorites’ land where you are now living. Yet as for me and my house, we will serve the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people answered and said, “God forbid that we forsake the Lord and serve other gods!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is the Lord our God who brought us and our fathers out from slavery in the land of Egypt and performed these great signs in our sight and guarded us all the way that we went and among all the peoples through whom we passed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord drove out before us all the people, even the Amorites, who lived in the land. So we will indeed serve the Lord, for He is our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua said to the people, “You are not able to serve the Lord, for He is a holy God. He is a jealous God, and He will not forgive your transgressions nor your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you forsake the Lord and serve foreign gods, then He will turn, bring disaster upon you, and finish you off, after having been good to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people said to Joshua, “No, we will serve the Lord!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joshua said to the people, “You are witnesses against yourselves, that you have chosen the Lord, to serve Him.”
Then they said, “We are witnesses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now then,” he said, “put away the foreign gods in your midst, and stretch out your hearts to the Lord God of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people said to Joshua, “It is the Lord our God we will serve, and His voice that we will obey.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that day Joshua made a covenant for the people and established regulations and laws for them at Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua wrote these words in the Book of the Law of God. He took a large stone and set it up under the oak by the sanctuary of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to all the people, “See, this stone will be a witness for us, for it has heard all the words of the Lord that He spoke to us. It will be a witness for us, lest you deny your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua sent the people away, each man to his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these events took place, Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died at the age of one hundred and ten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They buried him in the territory of his inheritance in Timnath Serah, which is in the hill country of Ephraim north of Mount Gaash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel served the Lord all the days of Joshua and of the elders who outlived Joshua and had known all the deeds that the Lord had done for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They buried the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel had brought out of Egypt, in Shechem in the part of the field that Jacob bought from the descendants of Hamor the father of Shechem for one hundred pieces of silver. It became an inheritance of the descendants of Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar son of Aaron died, and they buried him at Gibeah, the town of Phinehas his son, which was in the hill country of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator
